lines.gurmukhi: Awid prmwid ibsmwid gurey nymh pRgt pUrn bHm joiq rwKI
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Paramaadi Bisamaadi Guray Naymaha , Pragat Pooran Braham Joti Raakhee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Salutation to the True Guru the wondrous form of the (root of all) Lord, in whom God Himself has lodged His light effulgent.

lines.gurmukhi: imil cqur brn iek brn huie swDsMg shj Duin kIrqn sbd swKI
lines.transliteration_english: Mili Chatur Baran Ik Baran Hui Saadhasanga , Sahaj Dhouni Keeratan Sabad Saakhee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the congregation assembled before God-like True Guru, praises of the Lord are sung and recited. All four varnas (caste based sections of the society) then integrate into one caste society.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm inhkwm inj Dwm gurisK s√çn Duin gurisK sumiq AlK lwKI
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Nihakaam Nij Dhaam Gursikh Sravana , Dhouni Gursikh Soumati Alakh Laakhee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru whose base is Lord's name, listens to the melodious paeans of the Lord's praise. He then realises his self that helps him perceive the imperceptible.

lines.gurmukhi: ikMcq ktwC kir kiRpw dY jwih lY qwih Avgwih piRAY pRIiq cwKI ]144]
lines.transliteration_english: Kinchat Kataachh Kari Kripaa Dai Jaahi Lai , Taahi Avagaahi Priai Preeti Chaakhee ?144?

Shabad OS B.translation: The True Guru showers his benediction in very small measure on such a person who gets engrossed in it and relishes the loving elixir of Lord's love. (144)
